required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Diagnostic Contribution of XENETIXÂ® CT PERFUSION in Pre-therapeutical Assessment of Hepatocellular Carcinoma

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to prospectively determine the diagnostic value of Xenetix-CT perfusion for the discrimination between well-differentiated hepatocellular carcinomas (HCC) and poorly/moderately differentiated HCC, in histo-pathologically proven HCC, and with the aim to cover the entire liver.

primary_outcome.measure: Blood Volume (BV) According to Degree of Lesions Differentiation
primary_outcome.time_frame: Within a week from CT perfusion to surgery
primary_outcome.description: The mean level of each CT perfusion parameter was compared between well differentiated and moderately/poorly differentiated lesions according to WHO classification evaluated off-site.

primary_outcome.measure: Blood Flow (BF) According to Degree of Lesions Differentiation
primary_outcome.time_frame: Within a week from CT perfusion to surgery
primary_outcome.description: The mean level of each CT perfusion parameter was compared between well differentiated and moderately/poorly differentiated lesions according to WHO classification evaluated off-site.

primary_outcome.measure: Permeability Surface (PS) According to Degree of Lesions Differentiation
primary_outcome.time_frame: Within a week from CT perfusion to surgery
primary_outcome.description: The mean level of each CT perfusion parameter was compared between well differentiated and moderately/poorly differentiated lesions according to WHO classification evaluated off-site.

secondary_outcome.measure: Arterial Liver Perfusion (ALP) According to Degree of Lesions Differentiation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within a week from CT perfusion to surgery
secondary_outcome.description: The mean level of each CT perfusion parameter was compared between well differentiated and moderately/poorly differentiated lesions according to WHO classification evaluated off-site.

secondary_outcome.measure: Portal Venous Liver Perfusion (PVP) According to Degree of Lesions Differentiation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within a week from CT perfusion to surgery
secondary_outcome.description: The mean level of each CT perfusion parameter was compared between well differentiated and moderately/poorly differentiated lesions according to WHO classification evaluated off-site.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total Liver Perfusion (TLP) According to Degree of Lesions Differentiation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within a week from CT perfusion to surgery
secondary_outcome.description: The mean level of each CT perfusion parameter was compared between well differentiated and moderately/poorly differentiated lesions according to WHO classification evaluated off-site. TLP = ALP + PVP

secondary_outcome.measure: Hepatic Perfusion Index (HPI) According to Degree of Lesions Differentiation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within a week from CT perfusion to surgery
secondary_outcome.description: The mean level of each CT perfusion parameter was compared between well differentiated and moderately/poorly differentiated lesions according to WHO classification evaluated off-site.

secondary_outcome.measure: Blood Volume According to Immunohistochemistry Parameter (Glutamine Synthetase)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within a week from CT perfusion to surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Glutamine synthetase is an immunohistochemistry parameter of hepatocellular carcinoma phenotype. Glutamine synthetase labelling was quantified and in case of positive quantification, classified in the following categories: 1-10%, 10-50% and >50%. In case of absence of glutamine synthetase labelling, lesions were classified in the "glutamine synthetase 0%" category.

secondary_outcome.measure: Blood Volume According to Immunohistochemistry Parameter (CD31)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within a week from CT perfusion to surgery
secondary_outcome.description: CD31 is an immunohistochemistry marker of microvessel density. CD31 labelling was quantified and in case of positive quantification, classified in the following categories: 1-10%, 10-50% and >50%. In case of absence of CD31 labelling, lesions were classified in the "CD31 0%" category.

secondary_outcome.measure: Blood Flow According to Immunohistochemistry Parameter (Glutamine Synthetase)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within a week from CT perfusion to surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Glutamine synthetase is an immunohistochemistry parameter of hepatocellular carcinoma phenotype. Glutamine synthetase labelling was quantified and in case of positive quantification, classified in the following categories: 1-10%, 10-50% and >50%. In case of absence of glutamine synthetase labelling, lesions were classified in the "glutamine synthetase 0%" category.

secondary_outcome.measure: Blood Flow According to Immunohistochemistry Parameter (CD31)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within a week from CT perfusion to surgery
secondary_outcome.description: CD31 is an immunohistochemistry marker of microvessel density. CD31 labelling was quantified and in case of positive quantification, classified in the following categories: 1-10%, 10-50% and >50%. In case of absence of CD31 labelling, lesions were classified in the "CD31 0%" category.

secondary_outcome.measure: Permeability Surface According to Immunohistochemistry Parameter (Glutamine Synthetase)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within a week from CT perfusion to surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Glutamine synthetase is an immunohistochemistry parameter of hepatocellular carcinoma phenotype. Glutamine synthetase labelling was quantified and in case of positive quantification, classified in the following categories: 1-10%, 10-50% and >50%. In case of absence of glutamine synthetase labelling, lesions were classified in the "glutamine synthetase 0%" category.

secondary_outcome.measure: Permeability Surface According to Immunohistochemistry Parameter (CD31)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within a week from CT perfusion to surgery
secondary_outcome.description: CD31 is an immunohistochemistry marker of microvessel density. CD31 labelling was quantified and in case of positive quantification, classified in the following categories: 1-10%, 10-50% and >50%. In case of absence of CD31 labelling, lesions were classified in the "CD31 0%" category.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects diagnosed for HCC and planned for surgery (lobectomy or transplantation) within a timeframe of 30 days between first imaging procedure used for the study and surgery.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who have undergone prior TACE (TransArterial Chemo Embolization), prior RFA (Radio Frequency Ablation) or prior SIRT (Selected Internal Radio Therapy) within one year before inclusion.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: A total of 96 patients were enrolled in 4 countries: Austria, Germany, South Korea and Switzerland.

group.title: CT Perfusion
group.description: Xenetix-CT perfusion imaging: Injection of 50 ml of Xenetix

group.title: All Included Patients
group.description: All patients included in the study.

measure.title: Sex: Female, Male
measure.population: For one patient, the gender was missing.

measure.title: Severity of cirrhosis (Child-Pugh score)
measure.description: Child-Pugh classification of severity of liver disease is evaluated according to the degree of ascites, the plasma concentrations of bilirubin and albumin, the prothrombin time, and the degree of encephalopathy. Class A: well compensated disease Class B: significant functional compromised Class C: decompensated disease For 7 patients, this score was missing.

outcome.title: Blood Volume (BV) According to Degree of Lesions Differentiation
outcome.description: The mean level of each CT perfusion parameter was compared between well differentiated and moderately/poorly differentiated lesions according to WHO classification evaluated off-site.
outcome.time_frame: Within a week from CT perfusion to surgery
outcome.population: A total of 77 patients were analyzed for CT perfusion parameters: 38 had lesions assessed as "well differentiated", 42 had lesions assessed as "moderately/poorly differentiated" and 3 had lesions assessed as "well differentiated" and "moderately/poorly differentiated".

group.title: Well Differentiated Lesions
group.description: Among the 90 lesions analyzed for CT perfusion parameters, 47 were well differentiated according to WHO classification.

group.title: Moderately/Poorly Differentiated Lesions
group.description: Among the 90 lesions analyzed, 43 were moderately or poorly differentiated according to WHO classification.

measure.population: A total of 77 patients were analyzed for CT perfusion parameters: 38 had lesions assessed as "well differentiated", 42 had lesions assessed as "moderately/poorly differentiated" and 3 had lesions assessed as "well differentiated" and "moderately/poorly differentiated".

outcome.title: Blood Volume According to Immunohistochemistry Parameter (Glutamine Synthetase)
outcome.description: Glutamine synthetase is an immunohistochemistry parameter of hepatocellular carcinoma phenotype. Glutamine synthetase labelling was quantified and in case of positive quantification, classified in the following categories: 1-10%, 10-50% and >50%. In case of absence of glutamine synthetase labelling, lesions were classified in the "glutamine synthetase 0%" category.
outcome.time_frame: Within a week from CT perfusion to surgery
outcome.population: A total of 77 patients were analyzed for CT perfusion and immunohistochemistry parameters. A patient could have several lesions in different groups: 3 patients presented at least 1 lesion in group10-50% and another lesion in group >50%; 2 patients presented at least 1 lesion in group >50% and 1 missing data; 2 patients presented missing data.

group.title: Glutamine Synthetase 0%
group.description: Absence of glutamine synthetase labelling

group.title: Glutamine Synthetase 1-10%
group.description: Quantification of glutamine synthetase labelling from 1 to 10%

group.title: Glutamine Synthetase 10-50%
group.description: Quantification of glutamine synthetase labelling from 10 to 50%

group.title: Glutamine Synthetase >50%
group.description: Quantification of glutamine synthetase labelling greater than 50%

measure.title: Blood Volume According to Immunohistochemistry Parameter (Glutamine Synthetase)
measure.description: Glutamine synthetase is an immunohistochemistry parameter of hepatocellular carcinoma phenotype. Glutamine synthetase labelling was quantified and in case of positive quantification, classified in the following categories: 1-10%, 10-50% and >50%. In case of absence of glutamine synthetase labelling, lesions were classified in the "glutamine synthetase 0%" category.
measure.population: A total of 77 patients were analyzed for CT perfusion and immunohistochemistry parameters. A patient could have several lesions in different groups: 3 patients presented at least 1 lesion in group10-50% and another lesion in group >50%; 2 patients presented at least 1 lesion in group >50% and 1 missing data; 2 patients presented missing data.

analysis.groups_desc: Multinomial logistic regression analyses were performed with each off-site CT perfusion parameters as explicative variables taken alone and each off-site immunohistochemistry categorized parameters as dependent variables.
analysis.estimate_desc: Odds-ratio is the risk to move from one immunochemistry category to the below one (among 0%, 1-10%, 10-50% and >50%) considering an increase of 5 units for Blood Volume

outcome.title: Blood Volume According to Immunohistochemistry Parameter (CD31)
outcome.description: CD31 is an immunohistochemistry marker of microvessel density. CD31 labelling was quantified and in case of positive quantification, classified in the following categories: 1-10%, 10-50% and >50%. In case of absence of CD31 labelling, lesions were classified in the "CD31 0%" category.
outcome.time_frame: Within a week from CT perfusion to surgery
outcome.population: A total of 77 patients were analyzed for CT perfusion and immunohistochemistry parameters. A patient could have several lesions.

group.title: CD31 1-10%

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events were recorded during and immediately after the CT perfusion examination over a 30 min follow up period.

group.title: Safety Set
group.description: All included patients receiving at least one injection of Xenetix, regardless of the quantity. This set was used for safety analyses.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: All written or oral papers and publications must have the joint agreement of the investigator and the sponsor. Each investigator agrees not to publish/submit/present the results of the study main criterion involving only the patients he/she has included. Any abstract project will be first submitted to Guerbet at least 10 working days before submission to the congress scientific committee.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Corinne Dubourdieu, PharmD, Head of Clinical Projects and Medical Writing
